bulletins.title: ABS warning lamp, brake system warning lamp and handbrake ON warning lamp illuminate when starting engine.
problems: ABS warning lamp, brake system warning lamp and handbrake ON warning lamp illuminate when starting engine.
causes: Possible trouble codes stored.
Battery voltage low when starting engine.

steps: Check for trouble codes. Rectify faults as necessary.
Charge or replace battery.

bulletins.title: Battery discharged.
problems: Battery discharged.
Irregular operation of AC compressor clutch.
causes: AC compressor clutch relay faulty.Note: This fault is only associated with relays made by Omron.

steps: Replace AC compressor clutch relay.

notes: Note: This fault is only associated with relays made by Omron.

bulletins.title: Battery discharging.
problems: Battery discharging.
causes: Low resistance in electric sun blind motor.

steps: Check resistance of electric sun blind motor. Specified resistance: 3 MΩ.
Renew electric sun blind motor if necessary.

bulletins.title: Creaking noise from windscreen wipers.
problems: Creaking noise from windscreen wipers.
causes: Windscreen wiper mechanism spindles corroded because of insufficient lubrication included at manufacture.
Worn windscreen wiper mechanism spindle seals because of insufficient lubrication included at manufacture.

steps: Clean corrosion from windscreen wiper mechanism spindles.
Grease windscreen wiper mechanism spindles.
Fit new windscreen wiper mechanism spindle seals.

bulletins.title: Electric power steering (EPS) inoperative.
problems: Electric power steering (EPS) inoperative.
Electric power steering (EPS) warning lamp illuminated.
causes: Poor connection between EPS pump motor and harness multi-plug.
Poor connection between engine control module (ECM) and harness multi-plug.

steps: Check harness multi-plugs to EPS pump motor and ECM. Ensure positive connection.

bulletins.title: Electric power steering (EPS) warning lamp illuminated.
problems: Electric power steering (EPS) inoperative.
Electric power steering (EPS) warning lamp illuminated.
causes: Poor connection between EPS pump motor and harness multi-plug.
Poor connection between engine control module (ECM) and harness multi-plug.

steps: Check harness multi-plugs to EPS pump motor and ECM. Ensure positive connection.

bulletins.title: Electronic stability program (ESP) warning lamp flashes during normal driving.
problems: Electronic stability program (ESP) warning lamp flashes during normal driving.
causes: Steering column shaft splined joint misaligned.
Yaw rate sensor incorrectly positioned.

steps: Electronic stability program (ESP) warning lamp flashes during normal driving Fig.118885.1.
Check steering column shaft splined joint for correct alignment. Ensure alignment of reference marks Fig.118885.2. Realign if necessary.
Check yaw rate sensor is positioned correctly. Ensure terminal side of yaw rate sensor faces rear of vehicle Fig.118885.3.
ViewView more informationFig.118885

bulletins.title: Engine difficult to start after re-fuelling when tank has run dry.
problems: Engine difficult to start after re-fuelling when tank has run dry.
causes: Insufficient fuel added to empty fuel tank.

steps: A minimum of 7 litres of fuel must be added to an empty fuel tank.

bulletins.title: Engine malfunction indicator lamp (MIL) illuminated.
problems: Engine malfunction indicator lamp (MIL) illuminated.
Possible trouble codes stored: P2A00, P0135, P1172.
causes: Faulty heated oxygen sensor (HO2S).

steps: Renew heated oxygen sensor (HO2S).
Re-program ECM with upgraded software.

bulletins.title: Engine malfunction indicator lamp (MIL) illuminates immediately after starting engine.
affected_vehicles: All models with LDA2/R16A2/R18A1/R18A2 engine codes, →2007.
problems: Engine malfunction indicator lamp (MIL) illuminates immediately after starting engine.
Trouble codes stored in engine control module (ECM) fault memory: P1683, P1684.
causes: Engine control module (ECM) software fault.

steps: Carry out electrical, mechanical and component tests (as applicable) to eliminate any other possible cause(s).
If no fault(s) found: Re-program ECM with upgraded software.

notes: Note: To carry out an effective repair a software upgrade will be required - refer to manufacturer.

bulletins.title: Engine oil level warning lamp illuminated even though engine oil level correct.
problems: Battery discharging.
Engine oil level warning lamp illuminated even though engine oil level correct.
Trouble code stored: P250B.
causes: Engine control module (ECM) software fault.

steps: Re-program ECM with upgraded software.

notes: Note: To carry out an effective repair a software upgrade will be required - refer to manufacturer.

bulletins.title: Front brake judder.
problems: Front brake judder.
causes: Excessive front brake disc runout.

steps: Check front brake disc runout is less than 0,04 mm. Reface or replace front brake discs as necessary.
Check front brake disc thickness variation is less than 0,015 mm. Reface or replace front brake discs as necessary.

bulletins.title: Front doors difficult to open from outside.
problems: Front doors difficult to open from outside.
Front doors will not open from outside.
causes: Front door misaligned.
Front door handle release cable incorrectly adjusted.
Front door lock mechanism faulty.

steps: Ensure front door is correctly aligned.
Ensure front door handle release cable is correctly adjusted.
If front door handle release cable is correctly adjusted:Renew front door lock mechanism.
Renew front door lock mechanism.
Renew front door lock mechanism.

bulletins.title: Front doors will not open from outside.
problems: Front doors difficult to open from outside.
Front doors will not open from outside.
causes: Front door misaligned.
Front door handle release cable incorrectly adjusted.
Front door lock mechanism faulty.

steps: Ensure front door is correctly aligned.
Ensure front door handle release cable is correctly adjusted.
If front door handle release cable is correctly adjusted:Renew front door lock mechanism.
Renew front door lock mechanism.
Renew front door lock mechanism.

bulletins.title: Fuel filler flap will not open.
problems: Fuel filler flap will not open.
causes: Insufficient spring tension on fuel filler flap.

steps: Fit additional spring to fuel filler flap Fig.1202060.1.
ViewView more informationFig.1202060

bulletins.title: Gears difficult to engage.
affected_vehicles: All 5-door models with 1,4/1,8 engines and manual transmission, 2006.
All 5-door models with 1,4/1,8 engines and auto shift manual (ASM) transmission, 2006.
problems: Gears difficult to engage.
Poor gear selection.
Possible auto shift manual (ASM) transmission trouble codes stored: P0909, P0919.
causes: Foreign objects and/or debris in gear selection mechanism.

steps: Remove any foreign objects and/or debris from gear selection mechanism.

bulletins.title: Immobilizer permanently active after attempting to jump starting vehicle.
problems: Immobilizer permanently active after attempting to jump starting vehicle.
causes: Transponder key was inserted in ignition switch when connecting jump start battery, which erases transponder key coding.

steps: Re-program transponder key.

bulletins.title: Instrument panel illumination illuminates when ignition switched OFF.
problems: Instrument panel illumination illuminates when ignition switched OFF.
Instrument panel not working.
Trouble code stored: U0155.
causes: Instrument panel faulty.

steps: Fit new instrument panel.

bulletins.title: Instrument panel not working.
problems: Instrument panel illumination illuminates when ignition switched OFF.
Instrument panel not working.
Trouble code stored: U0155.
causes: Instrument panel faulty.

steps: Fit new instrument panel.

bulletins.title: Interior lamp permanently illuminated.
problems: Battery discharging.
Interior lamp permanently illuminated.
causes: Retaining clip not securing interior lamp wiring harness sufficiently.
Interior lamp wiring harness trapped by lamp assembly retaining screw.

steps: Repair interior lamp wiring harness.
Ensure interior lamp wiring harness held in retaining clip.

bulletins.title: Irregular operation of AC compressor clutch.
problems: Battery discharged.
Irregular operation of AC compressor clutch.
causes: AC compressor clutch relay faulty.Note: This fault is only associated with relays made by Omron.

steps: Replace AC compressor clutch relay.

notes: Note: This fault is only associated with relays made by Omron.

bulletins.title: Knocking/squeaking noise from rear suspension when moving from stationary following overnight standing.
problems: Knocking/squeaking noise from rear suspension when moving from stationary following overnight standing.
causes: Excessive friction between rear shock absorber damper rod and shock absorber damper rod seal.

steps: Lubricate shock absorber damper rod with grease. Use special tool: Grease application tool 52610-SMG-ZS00.

bulletins.title: Metallic clicking noise from RH front of vehicle when braking sharply or accelerating abruptly.
problems: Metallic clicking noise from RH front of vehicle when braking sharply or accelerating abruptly.
causes: Build up of debris between front subframe sections.

steps: Clean and grease area between front subframe sections.Remove subframe mounting bolts Fig.119082.1.Slacken subframe mounting bolt Fig.119082.2.Apply grease to contact surfaces between front subframe sections Fig.119082.3.Tighten subframe mounting bolt Fig.119082.2. Tightening torque: 106 Nm.Refit subframe mounting bolts Fig.119082.1. Tightening torque: 60 Nm.
Remove subframe mounting bolts Fig.119082.1.
Slacken subframe mounting bolt Fig.119082.2.
Apply grease to contact surfaces between front subframe sections Fig.119082.3.
Tighten subframe mounting bolt Fig.119082.2. Tightening torque: 106 Nm.
Refit subframe mounting bolts Fig.119082.1. Tightening torque: 60 Nm.
Remove subframe mounting bolts Fig.119082.1.
Slacken subframe mounting bolt Fig.119082.2.
Apply grease to contact surfaces between front subframe sections Fig.119082.3.
Tighten subframe mounting bolt Fig.119082.2. Tightening torque: 106 Nm.
Refit subframe mounting bolts Fig.119082.1. Tightening torque: 60 Nm.
ViewView more informationFig.119082

bulletins.title: Noise from rear suspension over uneven surfaces or speed humps.
problems: Noise from rear suspension over uneven surfaces or speed humps.
causes: Rear suspension spring not located correctly against end stop.

steps: Check rear suspension spring positioned correctly. Adjust if necessary.

bulletins.title: Poor gear selection.
affected_vehicles: All 5-door models with 1,4/1,8 engines and manual transmission, 2006.
All 5-door models with 1,4/1,8 engines and auto shift manual (ASM) transmission, 2006.
problems: Gears difficult to engage.
Poor gear selection.
Possible auto shift manual (ASM) transmission trouble codes stored: P0909, P0919.
causes: Foreign objects and/or debris in gear selection mechanism.

steps: Remove any foreign objects and/or debris from gear selection mechanism.

bulletins.title: Pop-up headlamp washers not retracting.
affected_vehicles: All models with pop-up headlamp washers, →2008.
problems: Pop-up headlamp washers not retracting.
causes: Dirt ingress to pop-up headlamp washers.

steps: Fit modified pop-up headlamp washers.

bulletins.title: Possible auto shift manual (ASM) transmission trouble codes stored: P0909, P0919.
affected_vehicles: All 5-door models with 1,4/1,8 engines and manual transmission, 2006.
All 5-door models with 1,4/1,8 engines and auto shift manual (ASM) transmission, 2006.
problems: Gears difficult to engage.
Poor gear selection.
Possible auto shift manual (ASM) transmission trouble codes stored: P0909, P0919.
causes: Foreign objects and/or debris in gear selection mechanism.

steps: Remove any foreign objects and/or debris from gear selection mechanism.

bulletins.title: Possible CAN data bus trouble codes stored.
problems: Possible CAN data bus trouble codes stored.
Trouble code stored: U0122.
causes: Poor earth connection for ABS control module.

steps: Locate and check condition of earth point:Civic - behind front bumper.CR-V - under ABS control module.
Civic - behind front bumper.
CR-V - under ABS control module.
If required: Clean/tighten earth point.
Check for trouble codes. Rectify faults as necessary.
Civic - behind front bumper.
CR-V - under ABS control module.

bulletins.title: Possible trouble codes stored: P2A00, P0135, P1172.
problems: Engine malfunction indicator lamp (MIL) illuminated.
Possible trouble codes stored: P2A00, P0135, P1172.
causes: Faulty heated oxygen sensor (HO2S).

steps: Renew heated oxygen sensor (HO2S).
Re-program ECM with upgraded software.

bulletins.title: Retractable door mirrors inoperative or slow to fold in.
affected_vehicles: All models with retractable door mirrors.
problems: Retractable door mirrors inoperative or slow to fold in.
causes: Electric mirror thermal cut-off switch faulty.

steps: Fit modified electric mirror thermal cut-off switch to door mirror.

bulletins.title: Retractable door mirror not working correctly.
problems: Retractable door mirror not working correctly.
causes: Incorrect synchronization of retractable door mirror motor mechanism.

steps: Re-synchronize retractable door mirror by operating 3-4 times.
If synchronization unsuccessful, renew door mirror.

bulletins.title: Splashing noise heard from instrument panel when accelerating and braking.
problems: Splashing noise heard from instrument panel when accelerating and braking.
Splashing noise heard from under front seats when accelerating and braking.
causes: Fuel movement in fuel tank. More pronounced due to fuel tank positioned under front seats.

steps: No action required. Normal operational characteristic.

bulletins.title: Splashing noise heard from under front seats when accelerating and braking.
problems: Splashing noise heard from instrument panel when accelerating and braking.
Splashing noise heard from under front seats when accelerating and braking.
causes: Fuel movement in fuel tank. More pronounced due to fuel tank positioned under front seats.

steps: No action required. Normal operational characteristic.

bulletins.title: Squeaking/creaking noise when clutch pedal depressed or released.
problems: Squeaking/creaking noise when clutch pedal depressed or released.
causes: Clutch master cylinder and clutch pedal misaligned.

steps: Slacken clutch master cylinder retaining bolts.
Fully depress clutch pedal and hold down.
Tighten clutch master cylinder retaining bolts. Tightening torque: 22 Nm.
Release clutch pedal.
